    • Method Detail

      • login

        public java.lang.String login(java.lang.String email,
                              java.lang.String password)
                       throws ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException
        This method that checks if a user is already registered in the system and can access by logging in the system. This will eventually be used to let different access depending on the user. If it is either a Resident or a Scientist
        Parameters:
        email - Is a string value that needs to contain the specific character "@" and one of the following extension .ca, .com, .org, .fr
        password - is an input string chosen by the user
        Returns:
        role a user of type Person with its attribute for name, email address, password, and role
        Throws:
        ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException - if there is no @ in the email, if the email does not end with one of the following extension .com, .ca, .org, or .fr., if the password does not match the email address, and lastly if the email address does not exist in the system.

      • register

        public ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Person register(java.lang.String name,
                                                       java.lang.String email,
                                                       java.lang.String password,
                                                       java.lang.String role)
                                                throws ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException
        This method permits a user to sign in, in the system of treePLE. Few informations are needed to successfully create an account
        Parameters:
        name - name of the user
        email - email address of the user to whom we can reach to
        password - a private password that is specific for this account
        role - a choice between signing in as a Resident or as a Scientist
        Returns:
        p will return an Object of type Person
        Throws:
        ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException - if there is no @ in the email, if the email does not end with one of the following extension .com, .ca, .org, or .fr., if the password does not match the email address, and lastly if the email address does not exist in the system.

      • createTree

        public ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Tree createTree(java.lang.String aSpecies,
                                                       float aHeight,
                                                       int aAge,
                                                       java.sql.Date aDate,
                                                       float aDiameter,
                                                       int aId,
                                                       ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Person aPerson,
                                                       ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Location aLocation)
                                                throws ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException
        This method is to successfully plant a tree in the system
        Parameters:
        aSpecies - species of tree that can only grow on the land of Canada
        aHeight - the height of the tree, that has a current maximum of 20 000cm
        aAge - the age of the tree
        aDate - the date it has been planted
        aDiameter - the diameter of the tree in cm
        aId - an ID to trace the tree in the system
        aPerson - the object of a Person to whom the tree belongs to
        aLocation - a location, specified with longitude, latitude and the municipality where the tree is planted
        Returns:
        tree a new Tree Object
        Throws:
        ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException - when any of these parameters is entered wrongly. or if one is not set

      • createTree

        public ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Tree createTree(java.lang.String aSpecies,
                                                       java.sql.Date aDate,
                                                       int aId,
                                                       ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Person aPerson,
                                                       ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Location aLocation)
                                                throws ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException
        This method is the short version for adding a tree in the system when it has been planted This was created for developers to facilitate the implementation and testing One feature of this method, is that a client can write a species name with Capitals or spaces and will look into the file if this trees can grow on the lands of Canada
        Parameters:
        aSpecies - the species of tree planted
        aDate - the current date it has been planted
        aId - the random id number to track the tree
        aPerson - the person it belongs too
        aLocation - its position on the map
        Returns:
        tree as it has been added to the system
        Throws:
        ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException - when the species entered contains characters that are not letters

      • findAllTrees

        public java.util.List<ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Tree> findAllTrees()
                                                                  throws ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException
        This method lists ALL the trees registered in the TreePLE System
        Returns:
        treeList a list of trees (all the trees registered)
        Throws:
        ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException - when no trees are registered

        Returns:

        public java.util.List<ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Tree> getTreesByArea(float lat,
                                                                           float lon,
                                                                           float radius)
                                                                    throws ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException
        This method searches for trees that is within a specific area (circular) with center at the location specified by longitude and latitude
        Parameters:
        lat - is the latitude of the point on a map
        lon - is the longitude of the point on a map
        radius - is the radius to determine the region
        Returns:
        treesByArea a list of corresponding trees
        Throws:
        ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException

                         float long1,

        This method is a helper method that returns distance between two points on GeoCoordinates This method is a simple implementation of Haversine's formula to calculate distance based on geocoordinates This method returns the distance in kilometer
        Parameters:
        lat1 -
        long1 -
        lat2 -
        long2 -
        Returns:
        d float distance of two coordinates

      • cutDownTree

        public boolean cutDownTree(int aId)
        Method that tells if the tree specified by ID is cutdown
        Parameters:
        aId - the id of the tree we want information on his status
        Returns:
        wasCutDown true, if the status of the tree was cut down, does not exist in reality false, if the tree is not cut down, exist in reality
        Throws:
        ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException

      • calculateBiodiversityIndex

        public double calculateBiodiversityIndex(java.util.List<ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Tree> trees)
        This method is to calculate the biodiversity index of a list of given trees. the index is a sustainability attribute to see how many different species there is relative to the number of individuals (trees)
        Parameters:
        trees - a list of trees of type Tree
        Returns:
        index a double that is a ratio between the number of different species over the number of trees

      • calculateBiodiversityIndexFromTrees

        public double calculateBiodiversityIndexFromTrees(java.util.List<java.lang.String> treesInArea)
        This method calculates the biodiversity of a given list of Strings
        Parameters:
        treesInArea - is the list of trees we want to fin the biodiversity on
        Returns:
        index a double that is a ratio between the number of different species over the number of trees

      • calculateCarbonSequestration

        public double calculateCarbonSequestration(java.util.List<ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Tree> trees)
        This method calculates a sustainability attribute called carbon sequestration. Carbon sequestration is the amount of CO2 in kg absorbed by the trees in an area
        Parameters:
        trees - is a list of trees where we want to calculate that amount of CO2
        Returns:
        result a number that is the amount of CO2 in kg

      • calculateCarbonSequestrationFromTrees

        public double calculateCarbonSequestrationFromTrees(java.util.List<java.lang.String> treeSpecies,
                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> treeHeight,
                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> treeDiameter)
        This method calculates a sustainability attribute called carbon sequestration given different types of lists. Carbon sequestration is the amount of CO2 in kg absorbed by the trees in an area
        Parameters:
        treeSpecies - list of tree species
        treeHeight - list of their associated height
        treeDiameter - list of their associated diameter
        Returns:
        result a number that is the amount of CO2 in kg

      • calculateWaterNeeded

        public double calculateWaterNeeded(java.util.List<ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Tree> trees)
        This method is a sustainability attribute to know what is the required amount of water we should water the trees in a specific area each month.
        Parameters:
        trees - a list of trees, to be able to get the diameters in cm of each tree to make the calculations on it
        Returns:
        water which is a double that is the amount of water required in Liters

      • calculateWaterNeededFromTrees

        public double calculateWaterNeededFromTrees(java.util.List<java.lang.String> diameters)
        This method is a sustainability attribute to know what is the required amount of water we should water the trees of a given area
        Parameters:
        diameters - a list of all the diameters of the trees in the given area
        Returns:
        water the amount of water recommended in Liters

      • containsString

        public boolean containsString(java.util.List<java.lang.String> diffSpecies,
                              java.lang.String name)
        The method containsString is to check if a string is present in a list of strings
        Parameters:
        diffSpecies - a List of Strings: here the list is a list of different species of trees diffSpecies
        name - a string name that needs to be compared to the ones inside the list
        Returns:
        true, if the string passed is already in the list

      • createSurvey

        public ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Tree createSurvey(java.sql.Date aDate,
                                                         int surveyId,
                                                         ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.model.Person aObserver,
                                                         int treeId,
                                                         float height,
                                                         float diameter,
                                                         java.lang.String status)
        Method to create a survey on a tree, this will permit to change data of a current tree in the system
        Parameters:
        aDate - the date when the survey has been conducted
        surveyId - the id to trace the survey
        aObserver - the name of the scientist conducting the survey
        treeId - the tree the survey is done on
        Returns:
        t1 return a survey of type Survey with all the information
        Throws:
        ca.mcgill.ecse321.treePLE.service.InvalidInputException
